name: dicomtools-0.8.14
body: This release fixes building against a namespaced VTK, updates the dictionary to DICOM 2022c, and handles the write-ahead log for the sqlite database.

name: dicomtools-0.8.13
body: This release further improves build support for VTK 9 and fixes a few bugs.  See the log for additional information.

name: dicomtools-0.8.12
body: This release contains a fix for using query files (the '-q' option) with the dicomtools on Windows.  It also updates the build system for the upcoming VTK 9. See the log for additional information.

name: dicomtools-0.8.11
body: This release contains bug fixes and improves the efficiency of dicomfind, dicomtocsv, and dicompull when searching through a large number of files.  The dicom dictionary has been updated to 2019d.  See the log for additional information.

name: dicomtools-0.8.10
body: This release improves the ability of niftitodicom to copy metadata from provided data sets, and provides various bug fixes.  See the log for additional information.

name: dicomtools-0.8.9
body: This update includes the DICOM dictionary from the DICOM 2018e release.  For users of the VTK classes, the vtkDICOMReader now lists the current file in its progress text.

name: dicomtools-0.8.8
body: This release updates the DICOM dictionary to 2018d, adds the ability to explicitly set time information in dicomtonifti, and fixes a 'vector iterator not dereferencable' exception that could occur on Windows in dicomfind and the other searching tools.

name: dicomtools-0.8.6
body: This release adds new features to the command-line tools, and fixes some bugs for reading OsiriX databases. Feature-wise, the dicompull tool gained the ability to create directory trees from any attribute values instead just a limited few, dicomtocsv has new options for printing the minimum, maximum, or a list of all values present for an attribute across a series, and the DICOM dictionary has been updated for the 2017d edition of the standard.  The bugs fixed for reading OsiriX databases are as follows: dates before 1970 were read incorrectly, all times were off by a few seconds due to a roundoff error, and daylight savings time was incorrectly applied.

name: dicomtools-0.8.5
body: This release fixes problems with using the command-line tools to perform searches for attributes that aren't in the root of the data set, particularly for private attributes.  Also, the tools now report data elements that are beyond the PixelData element (7FE0,0010).

name: dicomtools-0.8.4
body: This release removes unused bits from the pixels (any bits beyond BitsStored), and fixes a potential bug with reading 4D PET.  Also, on Mac OS, it uses an updated version of SQLite that works with the database files created by recent versions of OsiriX.

name: dicomtools-0.8.3
body:
This release fixes a critical bug where vtkDICOMReader would create a PatientMatrix with a negative determinant if SetMemoryRowOrderToFileNative() was not used.  Anyone who is using the GetPatientMatrix() method should update immediately.  This bug does not effect the dicomtools programs.  Another important bug fix relates to the use of setlocale(), which could cause incorrect encoding of DS elements for some locales due to their use of "," as a decimal point.

The two main additions in this release are overlay support (for both the reader and writer), and a dictionary update from DICOM 2017c.

name: dicomtools-0.8.2
body: Remove a debug print statement that was accidentally included in dicomtools-0.8.1.

name: dicomtools-0.8.1
body: Updates the dictionary for DICOM 2017b and reorganizes some of the character set code. (Note: This release accidentally included code that prints "CountBackslashes 0 ISO_IR 100".  Please use an earlier or later release instead.)

name: dicomtools-0.8.0
body: Two big changes in this release: 1) The vtkDICOMReader now applies the RescaleSlope and RescaleIntercept to output "modality" values instead of "stored" values (the AutoRescaleOff() method reverts the behavior.)  2) The command-line tools have a '--charset' option that can be used to specify the character set for old or non-conforming files that lack a SpecificCharacterSet attribute.  Also, an important bug was fixed for Windows: when vtk-dicom calls GDCM (e.g. for decompressing files), the filename no longer has to be ASCII.  The local (ANSI) windows character set can be used.

name: dicomtools-0.7.11
body: This release updates the dictionary to DICOM 2017a, fixes a few bugs, and adds more options to the command-line tools.  Of particular note is that [dicomtocsv](https://github.com/dgobbi/vtk-dicom/wiki/dicomtocsv) will no longer skip non-image DICOM files by default.  Click on the release commit on the left (the hexadecimal number) or download one of the packages for the changelog.

name: Source-only release 0.7.10
body:
This release exists to resolve a build issue caused by a very recent dependency change in VTK.  It is otherwise identical to v0.7.9.

If you want to build vtk-dicom yourself with VTK 7.1, then use this release (or even better, get the master branch).  If you want to download the latest dicomtools, then get the v0.7.9 binary release.

name: dicomtools-0.7.9
body: This release provides additional documentation.  The dicomtool documentation has been expanded at http://github.com/dgobbi/vtk-dicom/wiki/Command-Line-Tools, and programming topic guides have been added at http://dgobbi.github.io/vtk-dicom/doc/api/pages.html.

name: dicomtools-0.7.8
body:
This is a binary release of the command-line tools from vtk-dicom.  These binaries are statically linked, and do not require VTK.  Documentation for the tools is provided in the packages, and is also available at http://dgobbi.github.io/vtk-dicom/doc/tools/

The minimum OS versions are FreeBSD 9.3, Ubuntu 12.04, OS X 10.7, and Windows 7.  The win32 package might also work on WinXP.
